awd_titl_txt: Experimental Research in the Physics of Elementary Particles
awd_abstract_narration: This action will provide continued support for an active                   group of two senior investigators and students for experiments                  on the scattering of high energy muons from nuclei.  The data                   is collected at Fermilab's Tevatron accelerator.  Fermilab                      experiment E665, "Deep Inelastic Muon Scattering with Hadron                    Detection" was first exposed to the muon beam in the summer of                  1985.  In March of 1990 the experiment was prepared to begin                    its final run.  To date, scattering studies have been                           completed with heavy nuclear targets.  By January 1992, the                     scattering data from hydrogen and deuterium should be complete                  and the final analysis begun.  These experiments probe the                      structure of nuclear matter and the formation processes for                     strongly interacting particles.  It is closely related to the                   scattering of neutrinos by nuclear matter and electron proton                   collisions, also supported by the National Science Foundation.                       In the out years of the grant period, other activities                     will be started including instrumentation development for the                   Superconducting Super Collider.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
